trans-unit.source: Represents an attachment to an e-mail.
The <xref:System.Net.Mail.Attachment> class is used with the <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailMessage> class.
All messages include a <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailMessage.Body%2A>, which contains the content of the message.
In addition to the body, you might want to send additional files.
These are sent as attachments and are represented as <xref:System.Net.Mail.Attachment> instances.
To add an attachment to a mail message, add it to the <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailMessage.Attachments?displayProperty=fullName> collection.
Attachment content can be a <xref:System.String>, <xref:System.IO.Stream>, or file name.
You can specify the content in an attachment by using any of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.Attachment.%23ctor%2A> constructors.
The MIME Content-Type header information for the attachment is represented by the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase.ContentType%2A> property.
The Content-Type header specifies the media type and subtype and any associated parameters.
Use <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase.ContentType%2A> to get the instance associated with an attachment.
The MIME Content-Disposition header is represented by the <xref:System.Net.Mail.Attachment.ContentDisposition%2A> property.
The Content-Disposition header specifies the presentation and file time stamps for an attachment.
A Content-Disposition header is sent only if the attachment is a file.
Use the <xref:System.Net.Mail.Attachment.ContentDisposition%2A> property to get the instance associated with an attachment.
The MIME Content-Transfer-Encoding header is represented by the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase.TransferEncoding%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.Attachment"></xref> class with the specified content string.
The properties are set as follows:
Property
Value
<xref:System.Net.Mime.MediaTypeNames.Text.Plain>.
<xref:System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding.QuotedPrintable>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains a file path to use to create this attachment.
fileName is `null`.
fileName is empty.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.Attachment"></xref> class with the specified stream and content type.
The <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase.TransferEncoding%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding.Base64>.
If the stream's <xref:System.IO.Stream.CanSeek%2A> property is `false`, the attachment and the <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailMessage> that contains it are not reusable.
You must supply a stream that can be searched to reuse an attachment.
A readable <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> that contains the content for this attachment.
A that describes the data in stream.
contentType is `null`.
-or-
contentStream is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.Attachment"></xref> class with the specified stream and name.

If `name` is not `null` or equal to <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName> (""), the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType> for this attachment is constructed with the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType.Name%2A> property set to `name`.
The <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase.TransferEncoding%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding.Base64>.
If the stream's <xref:System.IO.Stream.CanSeek%2A> property is `false`, the attachment and the <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailMessage> that contains it are not reusable.
You must supply a stream that can be searched in order to reuse an attachment.
A readable <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> that contains the content for this attachment.

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the value for the <xref href="System.Net.Mime.ContentType.Name"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Net.Mime.ContentType"></xref> associated with this attachment.
This value can be `null`.
contentStream is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.Attachment"></xref> class with the specified content string and <xref href="System.Net.Mime.ContentType"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains a file path to use to create this attachment.
A that describes the data in string.
fileName is `null`.
mediaType is not in the correct format.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.Attachment"></xref> class with the specified content string and MIME type information.

If `mediaType` is `null` or equal to <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName> (""), the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType.MediaType%2A> property for this attachment is set to <xref:System.Net.Mime.MediaTypeNames.Text.Plain>.
If `mediaType` is not `null` and is not a zero-length string, it is used to construct the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType> associated with this attachment.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the content for this attachment.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the MIME Content-Header information for this attachment.
This value can be `null`.
fileName is `null`.
mediaType is not in the correct format.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.Attachment"></xref> class with the specified stream, name, and MIME type information.
If `mediaType` is not `null` or equal to <xref:System.String?displayProperty=fullName> (""), it is used to construct the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType> class associated with this attachment.
If `mediaType` and `name` both contain <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentType.Name%2A> information, the value specified in `name` is used.
The <xref:System.Net.Mail.AttachmentBase.TransferEncoding%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Net.Mime.TransferEncoding.Base64>.
If the stream's <xref:System.IO.Stream.CanSeek%2A> property is `false`, the attachment and the <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailMessage> that contains it are not reusable.
You must supply a stream that can be searched in order to reuse an attachment.
A readable <xref href="System.IO.Stream"></xref> that contains the content for this attachment.

A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the value for the <xref href="System.Net.Mime.ContentType.Name"></xref> property of the <xref href="System.Net.Mime.ContentType"></xref> associated with this attachment.
This value can be `null`.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the MIME Content-Header information for this attachment.
This value can be `null`.
stream is `null`.
mediaType is not in the correct format.
Gets the MIME content disposition for this attachment.
The information in the <xref:System.Net.Mime.ContentDisposition> class represents the MIME Content-Disposition header.
This header is described in RFC 2183, available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).
A <xref href="System.Net.Mime.ContentDisposition"></xref> that provides the presentation information for this attachment.
Creates a mail attachment using the content from the specified string, and the specified <xref href="System.Net.Mime.ContentType"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the content for this attachment.
A <xref href="System.Net.Mime.ContentType"></xref> object that represents the Multipurpose Internet Mail Exchange (MIME) protocol Content-Type header to be used.
An object of type <xref href="System.Net.Mail.Attachment"></xref>.
Creates a mail attachment using the content from the specified string, and the specified MIME content type name.
If the content is in ASCII format then the character encoding is set to ASCII.
For all other formats, the character encoding is set to utf-8.
The default media type is plain text.
If the content is not in ASCII format and the encoding is null, utf-8 encoding is used.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the content for this attachment.
The MIME content type name value in the content type associated with this attachment.
An object of type <xref href="System.Net.Mail.Attachment"></xref>.
Creates a mail attachment using the content from the specified string, the specified MIME content type name, character encoding, and MIME header information for the attachment.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the content for this attachment.
The MIME content type name value in the content type associated with this attachment.
An <xref href="System.Text.Encoding"></xref>.
This value can be `null`.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that contains the MIME Content-Header information for this attachment.
This value can be `null`.
An object of type <xref href="System.Net.Mail.Attachment"></xref>.
Gets or sets the MIME content type name value in the content type associated with this attachment.
The <xref:System.Net.Mail.Attachment.Name%2A> property is used in the Content-Type header generated for this attachment.
The <xref:System.Net.Mail.Attachment.Name%2A> is displayed as the attachmentâ€™s name when the email with the attachment is received.
A grammar that details the syntax of the Content-Type header is described in RFC 2045 Section 5.1.
RFC 2046 provides detailed information about MIME media types and their parameters.
These RFCs are available at [http://www.ietf.org](http://www.ietf.org/).
A that contains the value for the content type name represented by the property.
The value specified for a set operation is `null`.
The value specified for a set operation is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref> ("").
Specifies the encoding for the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.Attachment"></xref><xref href="System.Net.Mail.Attachment.Name"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.Text.Encoding"></xref> value that specifies the type of name encoding.
The default value is determined from the name of the attachment.
